result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron J Tomko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no direct or indirect contact with the victim, Kristin Bestul.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron J Tomko

records.addlTxt: Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  State moves to amend charge to Misd Theft, 943.20(1)(a)&(3)(a); Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on amended Ct 1.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Counsel req adj.    Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP  Counsel's first appearance; adj requested.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
No contact with K.B. direct or indirect
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def appeared in person.  Atty Jeanette Kara Corbett for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Pretrial held; no agreement reached.  Def referred to SPD (slip provided).  Court sets $2000 signature bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.    Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney and for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Initial appearance on December 1, 2014 at 09:45 am.
